title: Grilled Pork Chops
ingredients: 4 bone-in pork rib chops about 2 inches thick
directions: In a large pot or bowl, add the cooled brine and the pork chops, making sure all of them are fully submerged in the brine. You can place a heavy plate on top to help them stay submerged. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Remove the pork chops from the brine. Rinse them under cold running water, then pat them dry with paper towels. Lay the pork chops on a platter so that they come to room temperature while the grill heats.
In a small bowl, combine the salt, cumin, black pepper, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Rub both sides of the pork chops with the oil. Sprinkle and massage the spice rub all over them.
Once the grill reaches 400 degrees F, place the pork chops on the hot side of the grill and press down firmly with a grill spatula.Sear for 4 minutes without moving them. Flip them over and repeat.
Move the seared prok chops to the cool side of the grill, then close the lid. Cook for 15 - 20 minutes, or until meat thermometer inserted in the center of the pork chop reads 145 degrees F.
Allow pork chops to rest for 5 minutes for serving.
